pronunciation: DECE'ASE [Latin to depart or to withdraw.]

definition.text: Literally, departure; hence, departure from this life; death; applied to human beings only.Moses and Elias, who appeared in glory, and spoke of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem. Luke 9:3 1.DECE'ASE, verb intransitive To depart from this life; to die.Gen. Washington deceased, December 1 4, 1 7 99, in the 6 8th year of his age.
